title: CIS
details: While CIS is more focused on the application of computer systems for business uses, computer science is more about the ways in which computing systems are programmed and designed. Both degrees have some overlapping information, but their ultimate outcomes are to serve different purposes.

title: Chemical Engineering
details: Chemical engineering is an engineering field which deals with the study of operation and design of chemical plants as well as methods of improving production. Chemical engineers develop economical commercial processes to convert raw materials into useful products

title: civil & structural engineering
details: Civil engineering is a professional engineering discipline that deals with the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical and naturally built environment, including public works such as roads, bridges, canals, dams, airports, sewage systems, pipelines, structural components of buildings, and railways.
courses: Mechanics of Materials, James M. Gere.

title: Electrical & Electronic Engineering
details: In this sense, electrical engineering is the branch dealing with “heavy current”—that is, electric light and power systems and apparatuses—whereas electronics engineering deals with such “light current” applications as telephone and radio communication, computers, radar, and automatic control systems

title: Mechanical Engineering
details: Mechanical engineers design power-producing machines, such as electric generators, internal combustion engines, and steam and gas turbines, as well as power-using machines, such as refrigeration and air-conditioning systems. Mechanical engineers design other machines inside buildings, such as elevators and escalators.

title: Medical
details: Similarly, there's been no shortage of evidence this past year of the vital work being done by medicine graduates, from developing and testing vaccines to treating COVID-19 patients on the frontline.We’ll always need well-trained doctors and medical staff. Given this, it’s perhaps no surprise so many of you are interested in pursuing a degree in medicine.As with several other subjects featured in this article, Harvard University was ranked the best place in the world to study medicine last year, ahead of the universities of Oxford and Cambridge.
courses: Bachelor of Veterinary Science & Animal Husbandry (B. VSc AH)
